subject: Design
title: Bauhaus: Where Modern Design Was Born
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Bauhaus: Where Modern Design Was Born.

hook.text: In 1919, a school opened in Germany with a radical idea: art and industry belong together.

buildup.text: The Bauhaus taught painters to think like engineers and engineers to think like artists.

discovery.text: They stripped design to essentials: function, geometry, and honest materials. No ornament.

twist.text: The Nazis shut it down in 1933. Its teachers fled to America and reshaped everything.

climax.text: Your IKEA furniture, your iPhone, your office building â€” all trace back to Bauhaus principles.

punchline.text: A school that lasted 14 years designed the next century.
